skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, validation tools, and animation concepts. Use when users request animated GIFs for Slack like "make me a GIF of X doing Y for Slack."
skill.summary: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, valida...

security_audit.summary: Official skill from the Anthropic skills repository. Minimal audit performed as required. No security issues identified.

content.value_statement: Slack GIFs often fail size or dimension limits. This skill provides utilities to build, optimize, and validate GIFs for Slack.
actual_capabilities: Assemble GIFs from PIL images or numpy arrays using GIFBuilder
Resize frames and reduce colors for emoji sized output
Deduplicate near identical frames to shrink file size
Validate GIF dimensions, size, duration, and frame count for Slack
Apply easing functions for smooth motion timing
Draw circles, stars, text, and gradients for frame composition
limitations: Requires Python dependencies from requirements.txt to run
Does not include prebuilt art assets or emoji fonts
Validation does not check Slack upload API or workspace permissions
Message GIF size rules are approximate and may vary by Slack client

use_cases.title: Animate branded emoji
use_cases.description: Create a short looping emoji GIF that fits Slack size limits.

use_cases.title: Automate GIF generation
use_cases.description: Generate GIFs from code frames and validate them before sharing.

use_cases.title: Quick reaction GIFs
use_cases.description: Produce small reaction GIFs optimized for Slack messages.

prompt_templates.title: Basic emoji GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 128x128 Slack emoji GIF of a pulsing star, 12 frames, 10 fps, 48 colors, and save as star.gif.

prompt_templates.title: Gradient background
prompt_templates.scenario: Add a smooth gradient and text
prompt_templates.prompt: Make a 128x128 GIF with a blue to teal gradient background and centered text WOW, 15 frames, 12 fps.

prompt_templates.title: Bounce animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Animate a ball bouncing using bounce_out easing, 24 frames, 15 fps, and optimize for emoji size.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 480x480 message GIF with 20 frames, reduce to 128 colors, deduplicate frames, save it, then validate for Slack.

output_examples.input: Create a 128x128 emoji GIF of a bouncing ball and check if it is Slack ready.
output: - Size 180 KB, Slack emoji validation passed

best_practices: Keep emoji GIFs under three seconds with 10 to 15 fps
Use 48 to 128 colors to control file size
Validate dimensions and file size before sharing
anti_patterns: Using thin 1 pixel outlines that look jagged
Relying on emoji fonts for graphics

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a Python skill that can be used from those platforms when they run Python code.

faq.question: What limits should I follow for Slack emoji GIFs?
faq.answer: Use 128x128 pixels, short duration, and fewer colors for smaller files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into an automated workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, the builder and validators can be scripted in a pipeline.

faq.question: Does it upload or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only reads and writes local files in your environment.

faq.question: What if validation fails for dimensions?
faq.answer: Resize to 128x128 for emoji or ensure a reasonable aspect ratio for message GIFs.

faq.question: How does this compare to general GIF tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on Slack specific constraints and provides validation helpers.
